congregation-sync.vo: The brother designated as videoconference organizer (VO) by the body of elders can use M³ to manage what media is made available to the technical A/V support team in his congregation.
congregation-sync.voCan: The VO, or someone designated by him, can:
congregation-sync.additional: upload additionalstrong> media to be shared during a meeting, such as for the circuit overseer's visit, or for public speakers' talks
congregation-sync.hide: hide media from JW.org that isn't relevant for a given meeting, for example, when a part has been replaced by the local branch
congregation-sync.recurring: add or remove recurring media, such as a year-text video, or an announcement slide
congregation-sync.synced: All who are synced to the same congregation will then receive the exact samemedia when they click the [FETCH] button.
congregation-sync.note: Please note that the congregation sync feature is opt-in and entirely optional.
congregation-sync.webdav: M³'s underlying sync mechanism uses WebDAV. This means that the VO (or someone under his supervision) needs to either:
congregation-sync.webdavServer: set up a secured WebDAV server that is web-accessible, or
congregation-sync.externalWebdav: use a third-party cloud storage service that supports the WebDAV protocol (see the [HOSTNAME] setting in the [CONG SYNC] section below).
congregation-sync.credentials: All users that wish to be synchronized together will need to connect to the same WebDAV server using the connection information and credentials provided to them by their VO.
congregation-sync.hostDesc: Web address of the WebDAV server. Secure HTTP (HTTPS) is required.
congregation-sync.hostNote: Note: The label for this field is actually a button that, once clicked, will show a list of WebDAV providers that have been known to be compatible with M³, and will automatically prefill certain settings for those providers.
congregation-sync.hostList: This list is provided as a courtesy, and in no way represents an endorsement of any particular service or provider.
congregation-sync.hostBest: The best server is always the one you own...
congregation-sync.portDesc: Usually 443 for standard HTTPS, but might differ depending on the site.
congregation-sync.passNote: Note: As detailed in their respective support pages, an app-specific password might need to be created for [BOX] and [KOOFR] in order to enable WebDAV connections to their services.
congregation-sync.folderDesc: This is the folder that will be used to synchronize media for all congregation sync users.
congregation-sync.folderChoices: You can either type/paste in a path, or use your mouse to navigate to the target folder.
congregation-sync.folderNote: Note: Make sure that all congregation sync users input the same folder path; otherwise the sync won't work as expected.
congregation-sync.settingsDesc: Once the VO has configured the [MEDIA SETUP] and [MEETINGSETUP] sections of the [SETTINGS] on his own computer, he can then use this button to enforce certain settings for all congregation sync users
congregation-sync.settingsExample: (for example, meeting days, media language, conversion settings, and so on).
congregation-sync.settingsNote: This means that the selected settings will be forcefully applied for all synced users every time they open M³.
congregation-sync.usingCongSync: Using congregation sync to manage media
congregation-sync.usageDesc: Once the congregation sync setup is complete, you're ready to start [MANAGE MEDIA] for your congregation's technical AV support team.
congregation-sync.screenshots: Screenshots of congregation sync in action

manage-media.imgAddSong: Adding a song for a public talk
manage-media.imgImportJWPUB: Importing media from a section in a JWPUB file
manage-media.imgPreviewJWPUB: Previewing media from a JWPUB file before importing

present-media.imgButton: Button to enter media controller mode
present-media.imgSelectMeeting: Selecting a meeting for which to display media
present-media.imgBG: Default media background, with automatically generated yeartext
present-media.imgMediaList: List of media that is ready to be presented
present-media.imgStandby: M³ media presentation in standby mode
present-media.imgVideoScrub: Moving to a specific time in a video
